replies.msg: Recently my friend Joe married Clara, his girlfriend from Tinder. They were married by a pastor at a cathedral. I said "wishing you a lifetime of love and happiness" my brother said "best wishes on this wonderful journey as you build your new lives together" My elder sister wrote "thank you for letting us share in this joyful day.We wish you all the best as you embark on this wonderful union!" My younger sister said "Congratulations on finding each other! Your greatest adventure has just begun!" My cousin said "wishing you fulfillment of every dream!" Joe honours his parents. He's thankful for what his parents have done for him. His sister is also a good daughter while his brother needs to be a better son. In the east teachers and parents stress thr importance of filial piety which means Chinese parental respect. They teach that you should honour your parents and take care of them. Recently Joe's cousin has stolen his watch. I was honour bound to tell him. His dad is a man of honour and great integrity. Both Joe and I are kickboxing fans. In march Fred will be fighting chris for the honour of his country. Winning thr championship is a matter of personal honour, family honour and national honour. Last month his church held a banquet in honour of fred. Joe asked whether I could do him the honour of accompanying him to the banquet which I did. It was a great honour to meet fred. Fred said humbly "it's a signal honour to have you here joe" We asked fred if he would do us the honour of becoming our kickboxing coach. He said "We'll see" A couple of waitresses did the honours and greeted the guests at the door. After we sat down Fred asked the waiter "will you do the honours and cut us a piece of chicken ?" Fred said to us "I would be honoured if you would come and see my fight in March" We gave him an affirmative response. Last year the chairman of the kickboxing organisation said to Fred "I would be honoured if you attended the hall of fame ceremony." which he did. He was honoured for his performance in his last fight. Besides winning the championship he was honoured with an award for excellence in grappling. Some people bought front row tickets at half price or less due to a computer problem but the organisation said they would honour these tickets nevertheless which could cost a million dollars in lost earnings. His great grandfather accepted a commission as a senior officer in the air force during the cold war. He was buried with full military honours. His uncle was broke several years ago because he bet the farm on his company which went bankrupt later. He managed to honour his debts in three years. Joe is a bunny lover. He has a Holland lop and a Netherland dwarf rabbit. In accordance with animal law in Osaka if your rabbit is a social animal you must have at least two of then living together. Most citizens honour it. Last sunday his cousin was almost swindled out of thousands of yen. I told him that person was a swindler who was trying to swindle money from her. The contract isn't worth the paper it's written on. Fortunately he listened to me. Otherwise the scammer would've swindled him out of thousands of yen. The swindler didn't honour the contracts. Some people

I said "wishing you a lifetime of love and happiness" my brother said "best wishes on this wonderful journey as you build your new lives together" My elder sister wrote "thank you for letting us share in this joyful day.We wish you all the best as you embark on this wonderful union!" My younger sister said "Congratulations on finding each other! Your greatest adventure has just begun!" My cousin said "wishing you fulfillment of every dream!" Joe honours his parents. He's thankful for what his parents have done for him. His sister is also a good daughter while his brother needs to be a better son. In the east teachers and parents stress thr importance of filial piety which means Chinese parental respect. They teach that you should honour your parents and take care of them. Recently Joe's cousin has stolen his watch. I was honour bound to tell him. His dad is a man of honour and great integrity. Both Joe and I are kickboxing fans. In march Fred will be fighting chris for the honour of his country. Winning thr championship is a matter of personal honour, family honour and national honour. Last month his church held a banquet in honour of fred. Joe asked whether I could do him the honour of accompanying him to the banquet which I did. It was a great honour to meet fred. Fred said humbly "it's a signal honour to have you here joe" We asked fred if he would do us the honour of becoming our kickboxing coach. He said "We'll see" A couple of waitresses did the honours and greeted the guests at the door. After we sat down Fred asked the waiter "will you do the honours and cut us a piece of chicken ?" Fred said to us "I would be honoured if you would come and see my fight in March" We gave him an affirmative response. Last year the chairman of the kickboxing organisation said to Fred "I would be honoured if you attended the hall of fame ceremony." which he did. He was honoured for his performance in his last fight. Besides winning the championship he was honoured with an award for excellence in grappling. Some people bought front row tickets at half price or less due to a computer problem but the organisation said they would honour these tickets nevertheless which could cost a million dollars in lost earnings. His great grandfather accepted a commission as a senior officer in the air force during the cold war. He was buried with full military honours. His uncle was broke several years ago because he bet the farm on his company which went bankrupt later. He managed to honour his debts in three years. Joe is a bunny lover. He has a Holland lop and a Netherland dwarf rabbit. In accordance with animal law in Osaka if your rabbit is a social animal you must have at least two of then living together. Most citizens honour it. Last sunday his cousin was almost swindled out of thousands of yen. I told him that person was a swindler who was trying to swindle money from her. The contract isn't worth the paper it's written on. Fortunately he listened to me. Otherwise the scammer would've swindled him out of thousands of yen. The swindler didn't honour the contracts.
